column4: Hello! I just did an upgrade to 10.10 through the update-manager, and now I don't have any working X/Gnome setup. After the first Ubuntu loading screen, it dumps me back to the terminals, where the startup seems to be hanging after 'Checking battery state'. Anyone else get this?
Ah. I'll hunt in aptitude for a minute. Maybe I can resolve this myself. :)
I would boot to recovery mode and make sure that all packages are installed and configured.
Will try.
yeah make sure ubuntu-desktop is installed and use dpkg to reconfigure everything

Appears to be! dpkg didn't do anything. Although booting into recovery mode nets me a higher resolution text display. Heh. lspci says I have an Intel Corporation Mobile GM965/GL960 Integrated Graphics Controller.
is ubuntu-desktop installed?
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
and sudo dpkg-reconfigure -a
ubuntu-desktop is indeed installed. Running those now.
Nothing happened with the apt-get 0 updates, etc. Running dpkg.
After going through reconfiguring console-setup in dpkg-reconfigure -a, I get this: dpkg-maintscript-helper: error: couldn't identify the package
which package?
Sadly, it doesn't say. :/
Is this an upgraded system or fresh install?
Upgraded system. Although given I backed up, and have my /home on a different partition, fresh install is looking like a great option. :)
that's why a seperate home is a beautiful thing. Saves time instead of troubleshooting god knows what went wrong during the upgrade
I figured it would be a good idea this time around. I'm curious what went wrong, all the same, but...not -that- curious.
Thanks for the help. :)
np
cdrecord
